thread.title: Jet Skiers Narrowly Escape Encounter With Carnival Cruise Ship
thread.title_full: Jet Skiers Narrowly Escape Encounter With Carnival Cruise Ship

author: Emily McNutt
title: Jet Skiers Narrowly Escape Encounter With Carnival Cruise Ship
text:
This post contains references to products from one or more of our advertisers. We may receive compensation when you click on links to those products. For an explanation of our Advertising Policy, visit this page . 
It’s been a dicey couple of days for the cruise industry when it comes to close encounters. Last week, we told you how the Celebrity Equinox came uncomfortably close to a Fort Lauderdale home , scaring the homeowners (and their dog), who filmed the entire thing from their deck. Now, there’s a new video of yet another close encounter, this time between the Carnival Magic cruise ship and a couple of jet skiers. 
On Saturday afternoon, Canaveral Pilots Association Captain Doug Brown was navigating the 130,000-ton Carnival Magic out of Port Canaveral when he noticed a jet ski operating in the channel. Brown then alerted a Brevard County Sheriff Marine Unit that was nearby, operated by Deputy Taner Primmer, which then approached the stray jet ski. In a series of scary events, the jet ski flipped over, leaving its two passengers stranded in the water. By working with the Carnival Magic captain and bridge team to maneuver away from the passengers, Primmer was able to pull them onto his boat and away from the impending cruise ship. 
The entire incident was captured by a passenger on the cruise ship and posted to YouTube. You can watch it, below: 
Featured image courtesy of Wikimedia Commons.
